definition: to deceive/to hoodwink/Taiwan pr. [meng1 hun4]
blind/dim-sighted
to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
confused/dirty/to mix/muddy/variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
to get away with it/to slip through/to bluff one's way out/Taiwan pr. [meng1 hun4 guo4 guan1]

sentences.english: He apparently doesn't remember all the lyrics, and la-las his way through.
sentences.chinese: 他顯然記不得所有的歌詞，只好啦啦啦地矇混過去。

sentences.english: A lot of moment, these coloring marble can deceive pass a barrier.
sentences.chinese: 很多時候，這些染色大理石都能矇混過關。

sentences.english: But both of them are stonewalling - they refuse to answer any questions at all.
sentences.chinese: 但是，這兩人都拒絕回答任何問題，企圖矇混過去。

sentences.english: He accused the minister of prevaricating.
sentences.chinese: 他指責部長用搪塞矇混過關。

sentences.english: He counterfeited the manager's signature to get by under false pretences.
sentences.chinese: 他僞造了經理的簽名，企圖矇混過關。

definition: to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
scene of the crime
female gossip/busybody
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
trying to hide it makes it more conspicuous (idiom); A cover up only makes matters worse.
to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to hug/to embrace
evil plan/evil schemes
to walk right into the trap
to be a thief
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
to boast
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
